728855f-b.text:
Fort Place, at Sherman Ave., showing one of the earth-works of an old British fort. It is about 75 feet directly north of the convergence of the aforementioned two thoroughfares. This is a set of
three views taken the same day.
November 7, 1915.
By Wm. T. Davis through P. L. Sperr.
728855f-b.folder: Fort Place & Sherman Avenue, Staten Island, NY

729653f-a.text:
Sherman Avene, east side, south from Fort Place to Benziger Avenue, showing the Sherman arms Apartments,
at No. 25.
April,1930
P. L. Sperr
729653f-a.folder: Sherman Avenue & Fort Place, Staten Island, NY

728856f-a.text:
(1)
Fort Plaoe, at Sherman Ave., showing one of the earth-works of an old British fort. It is about seventy-five feet directly north of the convergence of the two thoroughfares.
November 7, 1915.
By Wm. T. Davis through P. L. Sperr.
(2)
The same at a later date.
April 21, 1923.
By Wm. T. Davis through P. L. Sperr.
